I am satisfied that we could not safely bring rent restriction to an end at the close of the present year and, although I think there are grounds for making oertain amendments in the law, I do not think it would be practicable to pass an amending Bill, -which must necessarily Involve several days of Parliamentary time, by Christmas,I propose, therefore, to provide for the continuance of the existing provisions in the Expiring Laws Continuance Bill which it will be necessary to pass in the Autumn.4, The Secretary of State for Scotland has seen, and concurs in, this Memorandum.23rd July, 1928.N.C .
